intro: Tofieldia nutans, commonly known as the nodding tofieldia, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which includes grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and marshes. Its inflorescence consists of dense, spike-like clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that droop downward. Tofieldia nutans is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and its ability to thrive in wetland environments.
